As the first Mexican-American congresswoman, serving a district that is home to many proud Mexican-American families, I look forward to continuing my work with Mexico’s LA Consulate to foster the deep and longstanding ties between the United States and Mexico. @ConsulMexLan

Had an excellent meeting with Mexico’s General Consul for Los Angeles, Marcela Celorio! I'm so pleased to work with our Mexican neighbors on matters of mutual concern, including the migration crisis at the U.S.-Mexico border.

DHS has urgent funding needs across its agencies, from procuring Coast Guard assets to improving the National Cybersecurity Protection System. I urge Acting Sec. McAleenan to work with me and my @AppropsDems colleagues to support those important missions.

DHS’s transfer and reprogramming authority is permitted only ‘in extraordinary circumstances that IMMINENTLY threaten the safety of human life or the protection of property.’ The department has not shown that these ‘extraordinary circumstances’ exist.
Once again, DHS has ignored the negotiated agreement with Congress by vastly exceeding the amount appropriated for immigration enforcement and removal operations.

I strongly disagree with DHS’s decision to transfer and reprogram funds to pay for more ICE detention beds and for hearing facilities to support the Administration’s inhumane Migrant Protection Protocols program. Read my letter to Acting Sec. McAleenan. pic.twitter.com/VHzxvcXxXS

Stopped in for a delicious late lunch at Pita GR: Greek Street Food during a day of site visits and meetings in #Downey. Our 40th District is blessed with so many incredible small businesses, and I'm honored to represent them in Congress! #CA40 pic.twitter.com/ElwvdJdkJb

Today is #WomensEqualityDay and the 99th anniversary of the #19thAmendment! As the first Mexican-American congresswoman, I'm proudly fighting for policies to hasten economic and social equality for all women, and to #ProtectTheVote for all eligible Americans. pic.twitter.com/RAI6GqwqrH
Let’s all mark this solemn day by recommitting ourselves to the fight against the many tragic legacies of slavery — racism, social and economic inequality by race, disenfranchisement, and more.

So much of the history of enslaved African Americans has been lost, but they are an indispensable part of our nation’s story. They helped build America. They *are* America. And the culture and contributions of their descendants keep shaping our country to this day.

Enslaved Africans were forced from their homelands and separated from their families. Generations of enslaved men, women, and children never knew freedom or dignity; instead, they faced assault, torture, and death.

400 years ago today, the first enslaved Africans arrived in English North America. The centuries of brutal slavery that followed were ended by the Emancipation Proclamation and 13th Amendment nearly 250 years later, but slavery’s horrible impacts endure to this day.
Feliz #PrimerDíaDeClases a todos los estudiantes, profesores, padres, y empleados en @ParamountUSD! Espero que todos tengan un año increíble! #WeArePUSD

We have heard time and time again from child welfare and health professionals that any amount of time in detention is unsafe and traumatic for children. We must #SaveFlores, #ProtectChildren, and end this cruelty.

Given that a federal court recently had to force the Trump Administration to provide toothbrushes and showers for children in CBP custody, we cannot allow any slippage of the legal rights for these migrants. #SaveFlores

The Flores settlement is not a loophole – it is designed to protect migrant children and ensure that they are treated with dignity and that their basic human rights are respected. Protecting children’s rights and due process is not optional. #SaveFlores
Knowing that detention is always harmful to children, it is infuriating that the Administration has decided to gut the Flores settlement. #SaveFlores

99 years ago today, the #19thAmendment was ratified—a crucial step in granting many women #VotingRights. However, it wasn't until 1965 that the Voting Rights Act helped protect EVERY eligible woman’s right to vote. Today, we all have a voice in the fight to protect voting rights.
Hey @dignityhealth @humankindness, @SEIU121RN #Nurses are fighting for patient safety and safe patient care. Nurses are the heart of healthcare. Do the right thing.
Como patrocinadora principal del #DreamandPromiseAct, estoy comprometida a luchar por una vía permanente hacia la ciudadanía para los soñadores (Dreamers) en todo el país. pic.twitter.com/NHNwwQt13s

Hace 7 años, El Pres. Obama creo DACA para jóvenes indocumentados cuyo único hogar son los EE. UU. Aunque Trump trató de destruirlo, muchos beneficiarios de DACA todavía pueden solicitar la renovación y protección. As the lead sponsor of the #DreamandPromiseAct  I am committed to fighting for a permanent pathway to citizenship for Dreamers across the country. pic.twitter.com/kBOodzea4E

7 years ago, Pres. Obama’s DACA program allowed undocumented youth to remain in the only country they call home. While Trump tried to destroy it, many DACA recipients can still apply for renewal & protection today. Learn more at:  https://roybal-allard.house.gov/uploadedfiles/daca_preliminary_injunctions_flyer_english.pdf …

Today, our delegation is in Honduras. We had a briefing from the U.S. Embassy, visited a bazaar, and met with Foreign Minister. I was also humbled to meet the mother of Berta Cáceres, who was murdered for her work to protect human rights, indigenous lands, and the environment. pic.twitter.com/3KHKXzoksw

Yesterday, our Congressional Delegation in El Salvador met with President @NayibBukele to discuss the causes of migration that affect his country and the United States. We also paid homage to the Jesuit priests massacred in 1989. pic.twitter.com/3d5Efwmaix

It's clear that U.S. assistance to Northern Triangle countries is essential to securing our borders. Most migrants to the U.S. are escaping gangs, poverty, and lack of economic opportunities. To reduce that migration, we must help strengthen these nations' economies and security.

Our Congressional Delegation is in El Salvador today as we continue meeting with public and private representatives in the Northern Triangle nations. As the wife of a Marine veteran, I was honored to greet the Marine detachment at the US Embassy before this morning's briefing. pic.twitter.com/mrZGAKMIdd

I've been taking part in our CODEL's informative meetings with Guatemalan civil, humanitarian, and business leaders. We've shared our mutual support for promoting security and stability in the region, and for enhancing economic opportunities for all Guatemalans. pic.twitter.com/lw9SyyUhow

I have introduced the Child Trafficking Victims Protection and Welfare Act to help us keep migrant children safe, care for trafficking victims, and prohibit family separation at America’s border. We cannot rest until every child is safe, healthy, and free from fear.

Today, our congressional delegation visited Guatemala’s Tour De Amour shelter, which aids returning migrant children. Tragically, many of these children have been victims of sexual violence and trafficking.  My heart broke for these kids – we must do all we can to help them. pic.twitter.com/RVXE542oEI

I’m joining @SpeakerPelosi and House colleagues on a bipartisan delegation to Central America’s “Northern Triangle” and to McAllen, Texas. As our CODEL began today, I spoke with U.S. Ambassador to Guatemala Luis Arreaga. @usembassyguate pic.twitter.com/ug5gk6OXBp

As a mother and grandmother, I have been heartbroken by the deaths of migrant children in our government's custody. We cannot allow @CBPgov to keep holding children and families in overcrowded and life-threatening conditions.

Every single migrant in our government’s care must be kept safe & treated humanely. As DHS @AppropsDems Chairwoman, I am fighting to ensure @CBPgov has the policies & resources it needs to meet this crucial goal, and to address public health concerns before they lead to tragedy.

And it is nothing short of grotesque for this president to try using lifesaving gun reforms as a vehicle to pass his cruel immigration policies. Our safety, and our children's safety, are not bargaining chips he can use to enshrine anti-immigrant bigotry in law.

Two days after a white supremacist went on an anti-Latino killing spree in El Paso, this president uses this mass shooting to promote his hateful immigration agenda.
